data.title: Great for a quick bite!
data.text: Simple menu, mostly hotdog and burgers! Cold beer. Many tvs showing sports. Has indoor and outdoor seating. Plenty of friendly staff.

data.title: Fun Place, Great Food
data.text: Located on Franklin Street across from the UNC campus. Great food and very good service.  Menu includes Hotdogs, Hamburgers,  Chicken and more.  Fun atmosphere.  Great place to hang out and watch a game; several big screen TV's.

data.title: Best atmosphere
data.text: Food is not what I would go for but you cannot beat the atmosphere and hence its popularity - will make you feel young.

data.title: Love this place
data.text:
Three times been....3 times happy....

Super friendly staff....great dogs...and a killer value...

Highly recommend this place...low key easy going (cmon...it's frigging hot dogs!!)

Would love it even more if they added  FenwayFrank..

data.title: Great dogs
data.text: A great place for good food. I've visited twice and enjoyed both times a lot. The SUP sauce is great with the fries. I would say this is a great spot to people watch in Chapel Hill.

data.title: Cheap & good eats!
data.text: We stopped here on a day trip to Chapel Hill and do not regret it. I ordered the chicken fingers and my fiancé ordered the Hawaiian burger. Both meals were awesome, no complaints! We brought our golden retriever puppy and they gave him a free hotdog! After all we figured its got to be pet friendly if "dog" is in the restaurant name. They have outdoor TV's to watch the sports games and I'm sure this place gets packed during college season. The service was great and we will definitely be back on our next visit!

data.title: not healthy, but tasty
data.text: Great place to go for cheap food (their special sauce is greeeeeaaat!!) and reasonably priced beer while watching the game.

data.title: Awesome chili dogs
data.text:
We stopped off here and enjoyed the favorite buffalo dog.  It was so good and even had tots that we're so Crispy and delicious.  Please go here and enjoy a delicious dog and tots, you won't be sad.   Highly recommend this place for a nice
Lunch.

data.title: Definitely worth it
data.text: I stopped by and dont regret it.. in Chapel Hill for the day.. i definitely am a big fan... the food was good and the staff are so nice. Went out of their way to make sure i enjoyed the experience.. they have done well making theirnstake in UNC culture just as their greenville location has... i will definitely return as much as possible.. its my firm believe that sup dogs is where its at for any occasion

data.title: Nothing Special
data.text: Ok but nothing special.  Food is made of cheap ingredients and way overpriced.  Dogs are small and no sides offered that are remotely healthy.  Wait staff was very friendly though.  Family's with kids beware...music playing is unedited so you will hear cursing in the songs including f-bombs.

data.title: Not the same atmospherr as Greenville, but the food is.
data.text: I'm bias because I went to ECU, home of the original Supdogs, so of course I miss the atmosphere of that location. The food at the Chapel Hill location is just as yummy. It's a bigger space with much nicer bathrooms so that's great. Mug night here is $2 on Mondays to fill your mug as opposed to the $1 fill in Greenville...not as great of a deal but understandable I guess. Definitely get the bacon cheese fries! Also, double your dog for only $1 more...worth it even if you have to take home leftovers! Drink-wise I'd recommend the orange sup crush. We'll always come back, I just wish they'd put a location in Raleigh.

data.title: Probably a great establishment, just don't go on gameday
data.text: After paying for a meal here this past Saturday, I was asked to leave this place because the restaurant was above capacity. So, I ended up having to leave my friends right in the middle of the UNC Duke game. The food was nothing special (it's not very hard to melt cheese on tater tots in my opinion) and obviously not impressed with the service.. Although this is probably not a very good representation

data.title: Fun place to get a bite and people watch!
data.text: Stopped here for a late night snack after a basketball game. Hot dogs and chili are very good. Prices are decent. They do serve beer and cocktails. The outdoor seating is nice. Service seems to suffer a bit when they are busy though.

data.title: Good doggie
data.text:
Good hotdogs and extensive options. Loyalty program if you visit often.
Owner very friendly and wants to make sure you are happy with your choice.

data.title: Sup to Five Stars Now
data.text:
I rate restaurants in terms of the genre, not on an absolute scale. No establishment that features hot dogs will ever compare favorably to Smith and Wollensky's, even less so 
Moulin de Mougins. But in this category, Sup Dogs is a ***** restaurant. The hot dogs are of superb quality, fresh ingredients and well-prepared, with a wide range of choices. The french fries are also first rate. Best of all, the pricing is remarkably reasonable. A winner . . . nearly as good as the world-famous Coney Island in Fort Wayne, Indiana.

data.title: Great addition to Franklin Street!
data.text: Stopped by late during homecoming. The atmosphere was great! The staff was upbeat, friendly and very accommodating at all hours! LOVE the Carolina spirit.  The food was great! And yes to the Sup dog sauce!!! Loved it!

data.title: Great Burgers too!
data.text:
The name on the door is misleading...the menu is more than hot dogs!  The hamburgers are excellent, freshly prepared to order, with an ample array of toppings.  The French fries are very good.  

Prices are most modest, and service is excellent, quick, and joyful.  That combination is rare.  Stop by for a snack or meal.

Note:  they do not service hot coffee, nor hot tea.  [there is a Starbucks nearby, so go there first]

Note also -- they do not serve Coca Cola only Pepsi products.  You may wish to substitute the sweet tea

data.title: Vegetarian hot dogs available
data.text: The atmosphere is casual and the service is friendly.  I was happy to see a vegetarian hot dog option on the menu.  I had the "Real deal veggie dog combo" and it was tasty, but difficult to eat. The cheese is shredded and put on top of all the other toppings.  Since they don't melt the cheese, it falls out of the dog when taking a bite. Next time I go, I'll request they put the cheese directly on the dog and melt it prior to putting the lettuce and other toppings.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Great, delicious food and fast service! It's one of our favorite restaurants to eat at on Franklin street!

data.title: Wide variety available
data.text:
The novelty of how many different types of toppings was not lost on me and took a while to make a decision..and then to decide on the type of side

The staff are very attentive and it's a friendly atmosphere, we sat outside enjoying the good weather. 

The dogs themselves were ok, our group was split with meat and veggie dogs and whilst the overall experience was enjoyed this was average food.
